newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Jurong Engineering wins S$63 mln deals.
newsitem.headline: Jurong Engineering wins S$63 mln deals.

text.p: Jurong Engineering Ltd (JEL) said on Thursday it had won three projects in Singapore worth Singapore $63 million.

It said in a statement Mitsubishi Heavy Industries had awarded it the mechanical erection contract for the Tuas South Incinerator plant. Work will start in June and is expected to be completed by February 2000.
The second project is for 28 passenger loading bridges and 16 aircraft docking systems at Singapore Changi Airport. The project is scheduled to be completed within 27 months by August 1999.
The third project was for the erection works for the installation of equipment, piping, insulation and painting of the Singapore Acrylic Ester Plant.
The contract was awarded by Toyo Engineering Corporation, the main contractor for the plant. It is scheduled for completion in August 1998.
JEL shares ended down two cents at S$3.02 on 122,000 shares on Thursday.
